channel.title: KISS Linux Blog
channel.description: An independent Linux® distribution with a focus on simplicity and the concept of "less is more". The distribution currently targets the x86-64 architecture and the English language.

item.title: 25/06/2020: This month in KISS (#3)
item.description: Welcome to the third monthly update for KISS Linux. The focus this month was on documentation and the reopening of the distribution's Wiki. A big thank you to those filling the Wiki with words.

item.title: 25/05/2020: This month in KISS (#2)
item.description: Welcome to the second monthly update for KISS. This post will be quite a long one, we've seen some nice changes this month and some great work by the Community.

item.title: 09/05/2020: KISS turns 1!
item.description: Today marks one year since the first commit to the KISS repositories.

First off. Apologies for the rather large delay in the release of this post. My laptop of four years decided to never again turn on. The model (Lenovo Yoga 900) is plagued with power issues which I came to know very well.

item.title: 04/10/2019: I've gone to great lengths for this silence
item.description: I’ve spent a lot of time ensuring this website remains small, simple and fast. To quote Futurama “When You Do Things Right, People Won’t Be Sure You’ve Done Anything at All”. I’ve gone to great lengths for this silence.
